title: Anzac Day: World War 1
subject_group: Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/World War, 1914-1918
Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/World War, 1914-1918 - Campaigns - Turkey - Gallipoli Peninsula
description: Richard Morecroft presents an overview of Australian involvementt in World War I, concentrating primarily on the Gallipoli campaign. Provides background history ot the war, the reasons for Australia's involvement, and details the events at Gallipoli whilst mentioning the arenas of combat in which Australian soldiers fought. Uses stills, archival footage, footage from propaganda and feature films related to World War I. Useful background to the story of Anzac Day, mentioning Simpson and his donkey, Turkish bravery and perceptions of the war. (SCHOOL PROGRAM ON THE GREAT WAR-SUITABLE FOR PRIMARY SCHOOL CHILDREN)
